programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Wildcats (14-4, 4-2 SEC) try to end a two-game slide away from home as they visit the Razorbacks (10-9, 1-5). Kentucky halted a three-game Arkansas run in the head-to-head series by taking an 88-79 decision in the second meeting of 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Crimson Tide (13-6, 5-1 SEC) roll into an engagement with the Tigers (11-8, 3-3). Alabama has won seven of its last eight after earning a 79-75 upset win over rival No. 8 Auburn on Jan. 24. Bama smoked LSU by 40 points at home in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 19 Tigers pay a visit to the Blazers. Memphis has won 18 of the last 19 meetings with UAB beginning with the championship game of the 2006 Conference USA Tournament. The Tigers have dropped two in a row by a combined three points.

programme.title: NFL PrimeTime
programme.desc: ESPN's iconic NFL highlight show continues to deliver on its mission of bringing football fans in-depth analysis of the action that happens on the gridiron around the NFL. Longtime host Chris Berman joins former players as they recap Sunday's NFL action with highlights in the way that only Berman can, which has made him a staple of sports television for 40 years.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Dukes seek revenge against the Mountaineers in a collision of top Sun Belt teams. James Madison has won three straight since a 59-55 loss to Appalachian State. Justin Abson (APP) collected 12 points, eight rebounds and four blocks in that game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Struggling Tinseltown foes take the floor as the Trojans play a game against the Bruins. The storied Los Angeles institutions share less-than-stellar 8-11 records this season. Boogie Ellis (USC) totaled 41 points in two games versus UCLA in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes seek a season sweep of the Pac-12 foe Huskies. Utah has won two straight meetings after a 95-90 decision in December that featured Branden Carlson's 34 points, seven rebounds and seven assists, and guard Gabe Madsen's double-double.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: A rotating roster of college basketball hosts and analysts discuss the latest headlines, top players and upcoming matchups.

programme.title: NFL's Greatest Games
programme.desc: The San Francisco 49ers defeat the Dallas Cowboys to earn a Super Bowl berth.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The revenge-hopeful Heat head for the Big Apple to play a matinee against the Knicks. New York won the first meeting this season, erasing a 21-point deficit to prevail 100-98 in an In-Season Tournament affair behind Jalen Brunson's 24 points.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lakers head north up the Golden State to renew their rivalry with the Warriors. In May 2023, Los Angeles needed six games to move past Golden State in the second round of the Western Conference playoffs. The Lakers are 6-15 as the visitor.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: For the second time in as many weeks, Joel Embiid and the 76ers play Nikola Jokic and the Nuggets. Embiid, the reigning MVP, outplayed the man who took home the award in 2021 and 2022 with a 41-point double-double in a 126-121 triumph Jan. 16.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner makes his Grand Slam final debut when he faces Daniil Medvedev for the Australian Open title. Sinner upset 10-time champion Novak Djokovic in the semifinals, while Medvedev rallied from two sets down against Alexander Zverev to advance.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 22 Florida Atlantic puts its five-game win streak on the line by hosting North Texas. The Owls swept both meetings with the Mean Green last season, but North Texas leads the all-time series 14-8. Johnell Davis (FAU) averages 18.2 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Shockers, mired in an eight-game winless streak, host the Mustangs. Wichita State's two victories over SMU last season extended the head-to-head win streak to seven. Kenny Pohto (WICH) scored 28 points in the double-overtime triumph at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates seek their first season-series sweep of the Owls. East Carolina topped Temple 73-62 on Jan. 10 behind a combined 53 points from RJ Felton, Brandon Johnson and Ezra Ausar. The trio provides 59% of the Pirates' offense this season.

programme.desc: The UFC's Women's Flyweight division has long been ruled by Valentina Shevchenko, but new contenders are on the rise. See Casey O'Neill, Andrea Lee, Maycee Barber, and more fight their way toward the top of the 125-pound rankings.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: When Khabib Nurmagomedov retired from MMA, the UFC's lightweight title was up for grabs. See the journey of the 155-pound belt following the Khabib Era, featuring Charles Oliveira, Dustin Poirier, Islam Makhachev, and more.

programme.title: UFC 266: Volkanovski vs. Ortega
programme.desc: Action from UFC 266, headlined by Alexander Volkanovski and Brian Ortega. From Sept. 25, 2021.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst is joined by Tim MacMahon, Tim Bontemps, and other insiders to sort out life in and around the NBA world.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.desc: The No. 17 Bluejays try to extend their win streak against the Big East foe Blue Demons to 20. DePaul last defeated Creighton in 2015. Bluejays 6-foot-7 guard Baylor Scheierman averages 17.9 points per game after scoring 20 in each of his last two.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Spartans and the Rebels get together for the first time in 2023-24. Last season, San Jose State swept the two-game series against UNLV for the first time since 2016-17. The Rebels claimed all 10 meetings during the intervening seasons.

programme.desc: The No. 9 Wildcats end a two-game stay in the Beaver State when they take on the Ducks. The schools split the 2022-23 season series, with Oregon earning a 19-point win over Arizona at home. N'Faly Dante (ORE) double-doubled in that contest.

programme.desc: The Heat and Sun end their season set. Grayson Allen's brilliant shooting night led Phoenix past Miami 113-97 on Jan. 5. Allen tied the Suns' franchise record with nine made 3-pointers in the victory, finishing with 31 points and two blocked shots.

programme.desc: The 76ers seek a second straight season-series sweep of the Trail Blazers. Philadelphia's third win in a row over Portland was a 126-98 thrashing on Oct. 29, 2023. Joel Embiid (PHI) set the tone for a potential second MVP award with 35 points.
